listItLogic

Class AddLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • listItLogic.AddLogic

  • public class AddLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    This class adds a task to the data file, by breaking down the string command and separates the different variables, in order to create the task object to be added.
    Version:
    0.5
    Author:
    Shrestha

      • addEventWithDeadline

        public static void addEventWithDeadline(java.lang.String command)
        This method adds a task object that has only a title and the deadline variable.
        Parameters:

      • isWord

        public static boolean isWord(java.lang.String word)
        Checks if the string variable is a word or not, in order to check for the date input by the user, and therefore parse it into the date object.
        Parameters:
        word - string word in the command
        Returns:
        true if it is a word, false if it is not a word

      • isDayOfWeek

        public static boolean isDayOfWeek(java.lang.String deadline)
        Parameters:
        deadline - deadline variable
        Returns:
        true if deadline is a day of the week, else returns false.

        public static java.lang.String getDeadlineMessage()

      • addEventDefault

        public static void addEventDefault(java.lang.String command)
        Adds an task consisting of just the event title. If no title is found, returns an error message.
        Parameters:
        command - string command input by the user with an "add" at the start

      • getDefaultMessage

        public static java.lang.String getDefaultMessage()

      • addEventWithImportance

        public static void addEventWithImportance(java.lang.String command)
        Adds a task that has the title and importance variable. Task may or may not have a date input.
        Parameters:
        command - string command input by the user with an "add" at the start

      • getRankMessage

        public static java.lang.String getRankMessage()

      • addEventWithTimeline

        public static void addEventWithTimeline(java.lang.String command)
        Adds an event with a timeline. Event can either have a timeline consisting of a single day timeline or a timeline that spans through multiple days
        Parameters:
        command - string command input by the user with an "add" at the start

      • addRecursiveEventDeadline

        public static void addRecursiveEventDeadline(java.lang.String command)
        Creates a recursive task event, by checking if the event has a title, recursive keyword "repeat", repeat type and the repeat cycle. Checks if all the type and cycles are valid inputs as well.
        Parameters:
        command - string command input by the user with an "add" at the start

      • getRecurMessage

        public static java.lang.String getRecurMessage()

      • isCorrectRepeatCycle

        public static boolean isCorrectRepeatCycle(java.lang.String repeatCycle)
        Parameters:
        repeatCycle - daily, monthly, yearly
        Returns:
        true if it contains the keyword, else returns false

      • addRecursiveEventTimeline

        public static void addRecursiveEventTimeline(java.lang.String command)
        Checks if the string command has the correct keywords, and then adds a recursive task to the task list. Else, displays invalid input if keyword is wrong.
        Parameters:
        command - string command input by the user with an "add" at the start

      • addBlockEvent

        public static void addBlockEvent(java.lang.String command)
        Adds a block event, which lasts over more than 1 day, to the task list. Checks if the keywords entered are correct as well.
        Parameters:
        command - string command input by the user with an "add" at the start

      • getBlockMessage

        public static java.lang.String getBlockMessage()

      • containsTime

        public static boolean containsTime(java.lang.String date)
        Parameters:
        date - date variable, with or without time.
        Returns:
        true if it has a time variable, else returns false
